title: Spectrum (functional analysis)
summary: In mathematics, particularly in functional analysis, the spectrum of a bounded linear operator (or, more generally, an unbounded linear operator) is a generalisation of the set of eigenvalues of a matrix.  Specifically, a complex number λ {\displaystyle \lambda } is said to be in the spectrum of a bounded linear operator T {\displaystyle T} if T − λ I {\displaystyle T-\lambda I}
